trigger: Transcriptional analysis of Epstein-Barr virus gene expression in EBV - positive gastric carcinoma : unique viral latency in the tumour cells .
Transcriptional analysis of Epstein-Barr virus gene expression in EBV - positive gastric carcinoma : unique viral latency in the tumour cells .

Although case-oriented evidence for an association of Epstein-Barr virus ( EBV ) with gastric carcinoma has been accumulating recently , the interaction ( s ) between EBV and gastric epithelial cells is / are largely unknown .

Although case-oriented evidence for an association of Epstein-Barr virus ( EBV ) with gastric carcinoma has been accumulating recently , the interaction ( s ) between EBV and gastric epithelial cells is / are largely unknown .

In this study , we examined seven EBV - positive gastric carcinoma tissues for viral gene expression at the mRNA level , from which studies on the EBV oncogenicity in human epithelial cells will benefit .

trigger: These findings further extended our previous data regarding EBV latency in gastric carcinoma cells at the protein level , and have affirmed that the programme of viral gene expression in the tumour more closely resembles 'latency I ' represented by Burkitt 's lymphoma than 'latency II ' represented by the majority of nasopharyngeal carcinomas .
